   20: -module(beam_ssa_no_opt_SUITE).
   21: -feature(maybe_expr, enable).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25:          calls/1,tuple_matching/1,recv/1,maps/1,
   26:          cover_ssa_dead/1,combine_sw/1,share_opt/1,
   27:          beam_ssa_dead_crash/1,stack_init/1,
   28:          mapfoldl/0,mapfoldl/1,
   29:          grab_bag/1,redundant_br/1,
   30:          coverage/1,normalize/1,
   31:          trycatch/1]).
   32: 
   33: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   34: 
   35: all() ->
   36:     [mapfoldl,
   37:      {group,p}].
   38: 
   39: groups() ->
   40:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   41:       [tuple_matching,
   42:        calls,
   43:        recv,
   44:        maps,
   45:        cover_ssa_dead,
   46:        combine_sw,
   47:        share_opt,
   48:        beam_ssa_dead_crash,
   49:        stack_init,
   50:        grab_bag,
   51:        redundant_br,
   52:        coverage,
   53:        normalize,
   54:        trycatch
   55:       ]}].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: calls(Config) ->
   71:     Ret = {return,value,Config},
   72:     Ret = fun_call(fun(42) -> ok end, Ret),
   73:     Ret = apply_fun(fun(a, b) -> ok end, [a,b], Ret),
   74:     Ret = apply_mfa(test_lib, id, [anything], Ret),
   75:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error()),
   76:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error(42)),
   77:     5 = start_it([erlang,length,1,2,3,4,5]),
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: fun_call(Fun, X0) ->
   81:     X = id(X0),
   82:     Fun(42),
   83:     X.
   84: 
   85: apply_fun(Fun, Args, X0) ->
   86:     X = id(X0),
   87:     apply(Fun, Args),
   88:     X.
   89: 
   90: apply_mfa(Mod, Name, Args, X0) ->
   91:     X = id(X0),
   92:     apply(Mod, Name, Args),
   93:     X.
   94: 
   95: call_error() ->
   96:     error(badarg),
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: call_error(I) ->
  100:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  101:     ok.
  102: 
  103: start_it([_|_]=MFA) ->
  104:     case MFA of
  105: 	[M,F|Args] -> M:F(Args)
  106:     end.
  107: 
  108: tuple_matching(_Config) ->
  109:     do_tuple_matching({tag,42}),
  110: 
  111:     true = is_two_tuple({a,b}),
  112:     false = is_two_tuple({a,b,c}),
  113:     false = is_two_tuple(atom),
  114: 
  115:     ok.
  116: 
  117: do_tuple_matching(Arg) ->
  118:     Res = do_tuple_matching_1(Arg),
  119:     Res = do_tuple_matching_2(Arg),
  120:     Res = do_tuple_matching_3(Arg),
  121:     Res.
  122: 
  123: do_tuple_matching_1({tag,V}) ->
  124:     {ok,V}.
  125: 
  126: do_tuple_matching_2(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  127:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  128:     if
  129:         Size =:= 2 ->
  130:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: do_tuple_matching_3(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  134:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  135:     if
  136:         Size =:= 2 ->
  137:             2 = id(Size),
  138:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  139:     end.
  140: 
  141: is_two_tuple(Arg) ->
  142:     case is_tuple(Arg) of
  143:         false -> false;
  144:         true -> tuple_size(Arg) == 2
  145:     end.
  146: 
  147: -record(reporter_state, {res,run_config}).
  148: -record(run_config, {report_interval=0}).
  149: 
  150: recv(_Config) ->
  151:     Parent = self(),
  152: 
  153:     %% Test sync_wait_mon/2.
  154:     Succ = fun() -> Parent ! {ack,self(),{result,42}} end,
  155:     {result,42} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Succ), infinity),
  156: 
  157:     Down = fun() -> exit(down) end,
  158:     {error,down} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Down), infinity),
  159: 
  160:     Exit = fun() ->
  161:                    Self = self(),
  162:                    spawn(fun() -> exit(Self, kill_me) end),
  163:                    receive _ -> ok end
  164:            end,
  165:     {error,kill_me} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Exit), infinity),
  166: 
  167:     Timeout = fun() -> receive _ -> ok end end,
  168:     {error,timeout} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Timeout), 0),
  169: 
  170:     %% Test reporter_loop/1.
  171:     {a,Parent} = reporter_loop(#reporter_state{res={a,Parent},
  172:                                                run_config=#run_config{}}),
  173: 
  174:     %% Test bad_sink/0.
  175:     bad_sink(),
  176: 
  177:     %% Test tricky_recv_1/0.
  178:     self() ! 1,
  179:     a = tricky_recv_1(),
  180:     self() ! 2,
  181:     b = tricky_recv_1(),
  182: 
  183:     %% Test tricky_recv_2/0.
  184:     self() ! 1,
  185:     {1,yes} = tricky_recv_2(),
  186:     self() ! 2,
  187:     {2,'maybe'} = tricky_recv_2(),
  188: 
  189:     %% Test 'receive after infinity' in try/catch.
  190:     Pid = spawn(fun recv_after_inf_in_try/0),
  191:     exit(Pid, done),
  192: 
  193:     %% Test tricky_recv_3().
  194:     self() ! {{self(),r0},{1,42,"name"}},
  195:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_3(),
  196:     self() ! {{self(),r1},{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  197:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_3(),
  198: 
  199:     %% Test tricky_recv_4().
  200:     self() ! {[self(),r0],{1,42,"name"}},
  201:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_4(),
  202:     self() ! {[self(),r1],{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  203:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_4(),
  204: 
  205:     %% Test tricky_recv_5/0.
  206:     self() ! 1,
  207:     a = tricky_recv_5(),
  208:     self() ! 2,
  209:     b = tricky_recv_5(),
  210: 
  211:     %% Test tricky_recv_5a/0.
  212:     self() ! 1,
  213:     a = tricky_recv_5a(),
  214:     self() ! 2,
  215:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  216:     self() ! any,
  217:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  218: 
  219:     %% tricky_recv_6/0 is a compile-time error.
  220:     tricky_recv_6(),
  221: 
  222:     recv_coverage(),
  223: 
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: sync_wait_mon({Pid, Ref}, Timeout) ->
  227:     receive
  228: 	{ack,Pid,Return} ->
  229: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  230: 	    Return;
  231: 	{'DOWN',Ref,_Type,Pid,Reason} ->
  232: 	    {error,Reason};
  233: 	{'EXIT',Pid,Reason} ->
  234: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  235: 	    {error,Reason}
  236:     after Timeout ->
  237:             erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  238:             exit(Pid, kill),
  239:             {error,timeout}
  240:     end.
  241: 
  242: reporter_loop(State) ->
  243:     RC = State#reporter_state.run_config,
  244:     receive after RC#run_config.report_interval ->
  245:                     State#reporter_state.res
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: bad_sink() ->
  249:     {ok,Pid} = my_spawn(self()),
  250:     %% The get_tuple_element instruction for the matching
  251:     %% above was sinked into the receive loop. That will
  252:     %% not work (and would be bad for performance if it
  253:     %% would work).
  254:     receive
  255:         {ok,Pid} ->
  256:             ok;
  257:         error ->
  258:             exit(failed)
  259:     end,
  260:     exit(Pid, kill).
  261: 
  262: my_spawn(Parent) ->
  263:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  264:                         Parent ! {ok,self()},
  265:                         receive _ -> ok end
  266:                 end),
  267:     {ok,Pid}.
  268: 
  269: tricky_recv_1() ->
  270:     receive
  271:         X=1 ->
  272:             id(42),
  273:             a;
  274:         X=2 ->
  275:             b
  276:     end,
  277:     case X of
  278:         1 -> a;
  279:         2 -> b
  280:     end.
  281: 
  282: tricky_recv_2() ->
  283:     receive
  284:         X=1 ->
  285:             Y = case id(X) of
  286:                     1 -> yes;
  287:                     _ -> no
  288:                 end,
  289:             a;
  290:         X=2 ->
  291:             Y = 'maybe',
  292:             b
  293:     end,
  294:     {X,Y}.
  295: 
  296: recv_after_inf_in_try() ->
  297:     try
  298:         %% Used to crash beam_kernel_to_ssa.
  299:         receive after infinity -> ok end
  300:     catch
  301: 	_A:_B ->
  302: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  303:     end.
  304: 
  305: tricky_recv_3() ->
  306:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  307: 	receive
  308: 	    {{Pid0,R0}, {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  309: 		{Pid0, R0,
  310: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  311: 	    {{Pid1,R1}, {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  312: 		{Pid1, R1,
  313: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  314: 	end,
  315:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  316: 
  317: tricky_recv_4() ->
  318:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  319: 	receive
  320: 	    {[Pid0,R0], {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  321: 		{Pid0, R0,
  322: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  323: 	    {[Pid1,R1], {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  324: 		{Pid1, R1,
  325: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  326: 	end,
  327:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  328: 
  329: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would accidentally create phi nodes on critical edges
  330: %% when fixing up receives; the call to id/2 can either succeed or land in the
  331: %% catch block, and we added a phi node to its immediate successor.
  332: tricky_recv_5() ->
  333:     try
  334:         receive
  335:             X=1 ->
  336:                 id(42),
  337:                 a;
  338:             X=2 ->
  339:                 b
  340:         end,
  341:         case X of
  342:             1 -> a;
  343:             2 -> b
  344:         end
  345:     catch
  346:         _:_ -> c
  347:     end.
  348: 
  349: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would find the wrong exit block when fixing up
  350: %% receives.
  351: tricky_recv_5a() ->
  352:     try
  353:         receive
  354:             X=1 ->
  355:                 id(42),
  356:                 a;
  357:             X=_ ->
  358:                 b
  359:         end,
  360:         %% The following is the code in the common exit block.
  361:         if X =:= 1 -> a;
  362:            true -> b
  363:         end
  364:     catch
  365:         %% But this code with the landingpad instruction was found,
  366:         %% because it happened to occur before the true exit block
  367:         %% in the reverse post order.
  368:         _:_ -> c
  369:     end.
  370: 
  371: 
  372: %% When fixing tricky_recv_5, we introduced a compiler crash when the common
  373: %% exit block was ?EXCEPTION_BLOCK and floats were in the picture.
  374: tricky_recv_6() ->
  375:     RefA = make_ref(),
  376:     RefB = make_ref(),
  377:     receive
  378:         {RefA, Number} -> Number + 1.0;
  379:         {RefB, Number} -> Number + 2.0
  380:     after 0 ->
  381:         ok
  382:     end.
  383: 
  384: recv_coverage() ->
  385:     self() ! 1,
  386:     a = recv_coverage_1(),
  387:     self() ! 2,
  388:     b = recv_coverage_1(),
  389: 
  390:     self() ! 1,
  391:     a = recv_coverage_2(),
  392:     self() ! 2,
  393:     b = recv_coverage_2(),
  394: 
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: %% Similar to tricky_recv_5/0, but provides test coverage for the #b_switch{}
  398: %% terminator.
  399: recv_coverage_1() ->
  400:     receive
  401:         X=1 ->
  402:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{list=L}
  403:             case id(0) of
  404:                 0 -> a;
  405:                 1 -> b;
  406:                 2 -> c;
  407:                 3 -> d
  408:             end;
  409:         X=2 ->
  410:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{fail=F}
  411:             case id(42) of
  412:                 0 -> exit(quit);
  413:                 1 -> exit(quit);
  414:                 2 -> exit(quit);
  415:                 3 -> exit(quit);
  416:                 _ -> b
  417:             end
  418:     end,
  419:     case X of
  420:         1 -> a;
  421:         2 -> b
  422:     end.
  423: 
  424: %% Similar to recv_coverage_1/0, providing test coverage for #b_br{}.
  425: recv_coverage_2() ->
  426:     receive
  427:         X=1 ->
  428:             A = id(1),
  429:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{succ=S}.
  430:             if
  431:                 A =:= 1 -> a;
  432:                 true -> exit(quit)
  433:             end;
  434:         X=2 ->
  435:             A = id(2),
  436:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{fail=F}.
  437:             if
  438:                 A =:= 1 -> exit(quit);
  439:                 true -> a
  440:             end
  441:     end,
  442:     case X of
  443:         1 -> a;
  444:         2 -> b
  445:     end.
  446: 
  447: maps(_Config) ->
  448:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,#{}},_}} = (catch maps_1(any)),
  449: 
  450:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, jkl => 0}),
  451:     {def,ghi,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, def => 0}),
  452:     {def,ghi,jkl} = maps_2(#{def => 0, jkl => 0}),
  453:     {mno,nil,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, mno => 0, jkl => 0}),
  454:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{jkl => 0}),
  455:     error = maps_2(#{}),
  456: 
  457:     [] = maps_3(),
  458: 
  459:     ok.
  460: 
  461: maps_1(K) ->
  462:     _ = id(42),
  463:     #{K:=V} = #{},
  464:     V.
  465: 
  466: maps_2(Map) ->
  467:     Res = maps_2a(Map),
  468:     Res = maps_2b(Map),
  469:     Res.
  470: 
  471: maps_2a(#{} = Map) ->
  472:     case case Abc = is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  473:              false -> false;
  474:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  475:          end of
  476:         true ->
  477:             {def, ghi, abc};
  478:         false ->
  479:             case case Jkl = is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  480:                      false -> false;
  481:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  482:                  end of
  483:                 true ->
  484:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  485:                 false ->
  486:                     case case Abc of
  487:                              false -> false;
  488:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  489:                          end of
  490:                         true ->
  491:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  492:                         false ->
  493:                             case Jkl of
  494:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  495:                                 false -> error
  496:                             end
  497:                     end
  498:             end
  499:     end.
  500: 
  501: maps_2b(#{}=Map) ->
  502:     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  503:              false -> false;
  504:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  505:          end of
  506:         true ->
  507:             {def, ghi, abc};
  508:         false ->
  509:             case case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  510:                      false -> false;
  511:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  512:                  end of
  513:                 true ->
  514:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  515:                 false ->
  516:                     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  517:                              false -> false;
  518:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  519:                          end of
  520:                         true ->
  521:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  522:                         false ->
  523:                             case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  524:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  525:                                 false -> error
  526:                             end
  527:                     end
  528:             end
  529:     end.
  530: 
  531: %% Cover code in beam_ssa_codegen.
  532: maps_3() ->
  533:     [] = case #{} of
  534:              #{ok := {}} ->
  535:                  ok;
  536:              _ ->
  537:                  []
  538:          end -- [].
  539: 
  540: -record(wx_ref, {type=any_type,ref=any_ref}).
  541: 
  542: cover_ssa_dead(_Config) ->
  543:     str = format_str(str, escapable, [], true),
  544:     [iolist,str] = format_str(str, escapable, iolist, true),
  545:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, [], true),
  546:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, iolist, true),
  547:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], false),
  548:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], bad),
  549: 
  550:     DefWxRef = #wx_ref{},
  551:     {DefWxRef,77,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999),
  552:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999),
  553:     {DefWxRef,77,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999.0),
  554:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999.0),
  555:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[option]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, [option]),
  556:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, []),
  557:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43}, []),
  558:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43.0}, []),
  559:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43.0}, []),
  560: 
  561:     nope = conv_alub(false, '=:='),
  562:     ok = conv_alub(true, '=:='),
  563:     ok = conv_alub(true, none),
  564:     error = conv_alub(false, none),
  565: 
  566:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, false, false),
  567:     {true,false}  = eval_alu(false, false, true),
  568:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(false, true, false),
  569:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, true, true),
  570:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, false, false),
  571:     {false,false} = eval_alu(true, false, true),
  572:     {true,true}   = eval_alu(true, true, false),
  573:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, true, true),
  574: 
  575:     100.0 = percentage(1.0, 0.0),
  576:     100.0 = percentage(1, 0),
  577:     0.0 = percentage(0, 0),
  578:     0.0 = percentage(0.0, 0.0),
  579:     40.0 = percentage(4.0, 10.0),
  580:     60.0 = percentage(6, 10),
  581: 
  582:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,42},_}} = (catch #{key => abs(("a" = id(42)) /= teacher)}),
  583: 
  584:     <<>> = id(<< V || V <- [], V andalso false >>),
  585: 
  586:     false = id(([] = id([])) =/= []),
  587: 
  588:     ok.
  589: 
  590: format_str(Str, FormatData, IoList, EscChars) ->
  591:     Escapable = FormatData =:= escapable,
  592:     case id(Str) of
  593:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars, IoList == [] ->
  594:             id(IoStr);
  595:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars ->
  596:             [IoList,id(IoStr)];
  597:         _ ->
  598:             bad
  599:     end.
  600: 
  601: contains(This, X, Y) when is_record(This, wx_ref), is_number(X), is_number(Y) ->
  602:     {This,X,Y,[]};
  603: contains(#wx_ref{type=ThisT,ref=ThisRef}, {CX,CY}, Options)
  604:   when is_number(CX), is_number(CY), is_list(Options) ->
  605:     {ThisT,ThisRef,CX,CY,Options}.
  606: 
  607: conv_alub(HasDst, CmpOp) ->
  608:     case (not HasDst) andalso CmpOp =/= none of
  609:         true -> nope;
  610:         false ->
  611:             case HasDst of
  612:                 false -> error;
  613:                 true -> ok
  614:             end
  615:     end.
  616: 
  617: eval_alu(Sign1, Sign2, N) ->
  618:     V = (Sign1 andalso Sign2 andalso (not N))
  619:         or ((not Sign1) andalso (not Sign2) andalso N),
  620:     C = (Sign1 andalso Sign2)
  621:           or ((not N) andalso (Sign1 orelse Sign2)),
  622:     {V,C}.
  623: 
  624: percentage(Divident, Divisor) ->
  625:     if Divisor == 0 andalso Divident /= 0 ->
  626:             100.0;
  627:        Divisor == 0 ->
  628:             0.0;
  629:        true ->
  630:             Divident / Divisor * 100
  631:     end.
  632: 
  633: combine_sw(_Config) ->
  634:     [a] = do_comb_sw_1(a),
  635:     [b,b] = do_comb_sw_1(b),
  636:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  637:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  638:     [] = do_comb_sw_1(z),
  639: 
  640:     [a] = do_comb_sw_2(a),
  641:     [b2,b1] = do_comb_sw_2(b),
  642:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  643:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  644:     [] = do_comb_sw_2(z),
  645: 
  646:     ok.
  647: 
  648: do_comb_sw_1(X) ->
  649:     put(?MODULE, []),
  650:     if
  651:         X == a; X == b ->
  652:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  653:         true ->
  654:             ok
  655:     end,
  656:     if
  657:         X == b; X == c ->
  658:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  659:         true ->
  660:             ok
  661:     end,
  662:     erase(?MODULE).
  663: 
  664: do_comb_sw_2(X) ->
  665:     put(?MODULE, []),
  666:     case X of
  667:         a ->
  668:             put(?MODULE, [a|get(?MODULE)]);
  669:         b ->
  670:             put(?MODULE, [b1|get(?MODULE)]);
  671:         _ ->
  672:             ok
  673:     end,
  674:     case X of
  675:         b ->
  676:             put(?MODULE, [b2|get(?MODULE)]);
  677:         c ->
  678:             put(?MODULE, [c|get(?MODULE)]);
  679:         _ ->
  680:             ok
  681:     end,
  682:     erase(?MODULE).
  683: 
  684: share_opt(_Config) ->
  685:     ok = do_share_opt_1(0),
  686:     ok = do_share_opt_2(),
  687:     ok = do_share_opt_3(),
  688:     ok.
  689: 
  690: do_share_opt_1(A) ->
  691:     %% The compiler would be stuck in an infinite loop in beam_ssa_share.
  692:     case A of
  693:         0 -> a;
  694:         1 -> b;
  695:         2 -> c
  696:     end,
  697:     receive after 1 -> ok end.
  698: 
  699: do_share_opt_2() ->
  700:     ok = sopt_2({[pointtopoint], [{dstaddr,any}]}, ok),
  701:     ok = sopt_2({[broadcast], [{broadaddr,any}]}, ok),
  702:     ok = sopt_2({[], []}, ok),
  703:     ok.
  704: 
  705: sopt_2({Flags, Opts}, ok) ->
  706:     Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
  707:     P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
  708:     case Opts of
  709:         %% The following two clauses would be combined to one, silently
  710:         %% discarding the guard test of the P2P variable.
  711:         [{broadaddr,_}|Os] when Broadcast ->
  712:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  713:         [{dstaddr,_}|Os] when P2P ->
  714:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  715:         [] ->
  716:             ok
  717:     end.
  718: 
  719: do_share_opt_3() ->
  720:     true = sopt_3(id(ok)),
  721:     false = sopt_3(id(nok)),
  722:     ok.
  723: 
  724: sopt_3(X) ->
  725:     %% Must be one line to trigger bug.
  726:     case X of ok -> id(?LINE), true; _ -> id(?LINE), false end.
  727: 
  728: beam_ssa_dead_crash(_Config) ->
  729:     not_A_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(id(false), id(true)),
  730:     not_A_not_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(false, false),
  731:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, false),
  732:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, true),
  733:     ok.
  734: 
  735: do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(A, B) ->
  736:     %% beam_ssa_dead attempts to shortcut branches that branch other
  737:     %% branches. When a two-way branch is encountered, beam_ssa_dead
  738:     %% will simulate execution along both paths, in the hope that both
  739:     %% paths happens to end up in the same place.
  740:     %%
  741:     %% During the simulated execution of this function, the boolean
  742:     %% variable for a `br` instruction would be replaced with the
  743:     %% literal atom `nil`, which is not allowed, and would crash the
  744:     %% compiler. In practice, during the actual execution, control
  745:     %% would never be transferred to that `br` instruction when the
  746:     %% variable in question had the value `nil`.
  747:     %%
  748:     %% beam_ssa_dead has been updated to immediately abort the search
  749:     %% along the current path if there is an attempt to substitute a
  750:     %% non-boolean value into a `br` instruction.
  751: 
  752:     case
  753:         case not A of
  754:             false ->
  755:                 false;
  756:             true ->
  757:                 B
  758:         end
  759:     of
  760:         V
  761:             when
  762:                 V /= nil
  763:                 andalso
  764:                 V /= false ->
  765:             not_A_B;
  766:         _ ->
  767:             case
  768:                 case not A of
  769:                     false ->
  770:                         false;
  771:                     true ->
  772:                         not B
  773:                 end
  774:             of
  775:                 true ->
  776:                     not_A_not_B;
  777:                 false ->
  778:                     neither
  779:             end
  780:     end.
  781: 
  782: stack_init(_Config) ->
  783:     6 = stack_init(a, #{a => [1,2,3]}),
  784:     0 = stack_init(missing, #{}),
  785:     ok.
  786: 
  787: stack_init(Key, Map) ->
  788:     %% beam_ssa_codegen would wrongly assume that y(0) would always be
  789:     %% initialized by the `get_map_elements` instruction that follows, and
  790:     %% would set up the stack frame using an `allocate` instruction and
  791:     %% would not generate an `init` instruction to initialize y(0).
  792:     Res = case Map of
  793:               #{Key := Elements} ->
  794:                   %% Elements will be assigned to y(0) if the key Key exists.
  795:                   lists:foldl(fun(El, Acc) ->
  796:                                       Acc + El
  797:                               end, 0, Elements);
  798:               #{} ->
  799:                   %% y(0) will be left uninitialized when the key is not
  800:                   %% present in the map.
  801:                   0
  802:           end,
  803:     %% y(0) would be uninitialized here if the key was not present in the map
  804:     %% (if the second clause was executed).
  805:     id(Res).
  806: 
  807: %% Test that compiler "optimizations" don't rewrite mapfold/3 to the
  808: %% equivalent of slow_mapfoldl/3.
  809: mapfoldl() ->
  810:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  811:     {Time,_} = timer:tc(fun() ->
  812:                                 mapfoldl(fun(Sz, _) ->
  813:                                                  erlang:garbage_collect(),
  814:                                                  {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  815:                                          end, [], [Size])
  816:                         end),
  817:     Seconds = 15 + ceil(10 * Time * N / 1_000_000),
  818:     io:format("~p seconds timetrap\n", [Seconds]),
  819:     [{timetrap,{seconds,Seconds}}].
  820: 
  821: mapfoldl(_Config) ->
  822:     test_mapfoldl_implementations(),
  823:     F = fun(Sz, _) ->
  824:                 erlang:garbage_collect(),
  825:                 {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  826:         end,
  827:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  828:     List = lists:duplicate(N, Size),
  829:     {List,Tuple} = mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  830:     {List,Tuple} = fast_mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  831:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  832:     ok.
  833: 
  834: mapfoldl_limits() ->
  835:     {1_000,100_000}.
  836: 
  837: test_mapfoldl_implementations() ->
  838:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 10),
  839:     F = fun(N, Sum) -> {N,Sum+N} end,
  840:     {Seq,55} = mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  841:     {Seq,55} = fast_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  842:     {Seq,55} = slow_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  843:     ok.
  844: 
  845: mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  846:     {R,Acc1} = F(Hd, Acc0),
  847:     {Rs,Acc2} = mapfoldl(F, Acc1, Tail),
  848:     {[R|Rs],Acc2};
  849: mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  850: 
  851: %% Here is an illustration of how the compiler used to sink
  852: %% get_tuple_element instructions in a way that would cause all
  853: %% versions of the accumulator to be kept until the end. The compiler
  854: %% now uses a heuristic to only sink get_tuple_element instructions if
  855: %% that would cause fewer values to be saved in the stack frame.
  856: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  857:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  858:     %% By saving the Res1 tuple, all intermediate accumulators will be
  859:     %% kept to the end.
  860:     Res2 = slow_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  861:     {[element(1, Res1)|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  862: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  863: 
  864: %% Here is an illustration how the compiler should compile mapfoldl/3
  865: %% to avoid keeping all intermediate accumulators. Note that
  866: %% slow_mapfoldl/3 and fast_mapfoldl/3 use the same amount of stack
  867: %% space.
  868: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  869:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  870:     R = element(1, Res1),
  871:     Res2 = fast_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  872:     {[R|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  873: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  874: 
  875: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  876:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_1()),
  877:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_2()),
  878:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_3()),
  879:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_4()),
  880:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,grab_bag_5,[a,17],_}|_]}} =
  881:         (catch grab_bag_5(a, 17)),
  882:     way = grab_bag_6(face),
  883:     no_match = grab_bag_6("ABC"),
  884:     no_match = grab_bag_6(any),
  885:     ok = grab_bag_7(),
  886:     [] = grab_bag_8(),
  887:     ok = grab_bag_9(),
  888:     whatever = grab_bag_10(ignore, whatever),
  889:     other = grab_bag_11(),
  890:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_12()),
  891:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[]},_}} = (catch grab_bag_13()),
  892:     timeout = grab_bag_14(),
  893:     ?MODULE = grab_bag_15(?MODULE),
  894: 
  895:     error = grab_bag_16a(timeout_value),
  896:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16a(whatever)),
  897:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16b(whatever)),
  898:     timeout_value = grab_bag_16b(error),
  899: 
  900:     fact = grab_bag_17(),
  901: 
  902:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,[]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_18(),
  903: 
  904:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[whatever]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_19(),
  905: 
  906:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_20(),
  907: 
  908:     6 = grab_bag_21(id(64)),
  909:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch grab_bag_21(id(a)),
  910: 
  911:     false = grab_bag_22(),
  912: 
  913:     ok.
  914: 
  915: grab_bag_1() ->
  916:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash when attempting to translate a make_fun
  917:     %% instruction without a destination variable.
  918:     (catch fun () -> 15 end)(true#{}).
  919: 
  920: grab_bag_2() ->
  921:     %% is_guard_cg_safe/1 will be called with #cg_unreachable{}, which was
  922:     %% not handled.
  923:     27
  924:         or
  925:     try
  926:         try
  927:             x#{}
  928:         catch
  929:             _:_ ->
  930:                 []
  931:         end
  932:     after
  933:         false
  934:     end.
  935: 
  936: grab_bag_3() ->
  937:     case
  938:         fun (V0)
  939:               when
  940:                   %% The only thing left after optimizations would be
  941:                   %% a bs_add instruction not followed by succeeded,
  942:                   %% which would crash beam_ssa_codegen because there
  943:                   %% was no failure label available.
  944:                   binary_part(<<>>,
  945:                               <<V0:V0/unit:196>>) ->
  946:                 []
  947:         end
  948:     of
  949:         <<>> ->
  950:             []
  951:     end.
  952: 
  953: grab_bag_4() ->
  954:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash because there was a #cg_phi{}
  955:     %% instruction that was not referenced from any #cg_break{}.
  956:     case $f of
  957:         V0 ->
  958:             try
  959:                 try fy of
  960:                     V0 ->
  961:                         fu
  962:                 catch
  963:                     throw:$s ->
  964:                         fy
  965:                 end
  966:             catch
  967:                 error:#{#{[] + [] => []} := false} when [] ->
  968:                     fy
  969:             after
  970:                 ok
  971:             end
  972:     end.
  973: 
  974: grab_bag_5(_A, _B) when <<business:(node(power))>> ->
  975:     true.
  976: 
  977: grab_bag_6(face) ->
  978:     way;
  979: grab_bag_6("ABC") when (node([]))#{size(door) => $k} ->
  980:     false;
  981: grab_bag_6(_) ->
  982:     no_match.
  983: 
  984: grab_bag_7() ->
  985:     catch
  986:         case
  987:             case 1.6 of
  988:                 %% The hd([] call will be translated to erlang:error(badarg).
  989:                 %% This case exports two variables in Core Erlang (the
  990:                 %% return value of the case and V). beam_kernel_to_ssa was not
  991:                 %% prepared to handle a call to error/1 which is supposed to
  992:                 %% export two variables.
  993:                 <<0.5:(hd([])),V:false>> ->
  994:                     ok
  995:             end
  996:         of
  997:             _ ->
  998:                 V
  999:         end,
 1000:         ok.
 1001: 
 1002: %% ssa_opt_sink would crash if sys_core_fold had not been run.
 1003: grab_bag_8() ->
 1004:     try
 1005:         []
 1006:     catch
 1007:         _:_ ->
 1008:             try
 1009:                 []
 1010:             catch
 1011:                 _:any:_ ->
 1012:                     a
 1013:             end;
 1014:         _:right ->
 1015:             b
 1016:     end.
 1017: 
 1018: %% The ssa_opt_try optimization would leave a succeeded:body
 1019: %% instruction followed by a #b_ret{} terminator, which would crash
 1020: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
 1021: grab_bag_9() ->
 1022:     catch
 1023:         <<1 || 99, [] <- hour>> bsr false,
 1024:         ok.
 1025: 
 1026: grab_bag_10(_, V) ->
 1027:     %% This function needs a stack frame in order to preserve V.
 1028:     fun() -> ok end,
 1029:     V.
 1030: 
 1031: grab_bag_11() ->
 1032:     try 0 of
 1033:         false -> error;
 1034:         true -> ok;
 1035:         _ -> other
 1036:     catch
 1037:         _:_ ->
 1038:             caught
 1039:     end.
 1040: 
 1041: grab_bag_12() ->
 1042:     %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would try to place the created map in x1.
 1043:     %% That would not be safe because x0 is not initialized.
 1044:     check_process_code(1, (#{})#{key := teacher}),
 1045:     ok.
 1046: 
 1047: grab_bag_13() ->
 1048:     %% If sys_core_fold was skipped, beam_ssa_beam would leave
 1049:     %% unreachable code with invalid phi nodes.
 1050:     case <<810:true>> = [] of
 1051:         <<709:false>> ->
 1052:             ok;
 1053:         whatever ->
 1054:             case 42 of
 1055:                 175 ->
 1056:                     {ok,case "b" of
 1057:                             $X -> time
 1058:                         end}
 1059:             end
 1060:     end.
 1061: 
 1062: grab_bag_14() ->
 1063:     %% If optimizations were turned off, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would
 1064:     %% sanitize the binary construction instruction, replacing it with
 1065:     %% a call to erlang:error/1, which is not allowed in a receive.
 1066:     receive
 1067:         #{<<42:(-1)>> := _} ->
 1068:             ok
 1069:     after 0 ->
 1070:             timeout
 1071:     end.
 1072: 
 1073: grab_bag_15(V) ->
 1074:     %% Instead of:
 1075:     %%
 1076:     %%    move x0, y0
 1077:     %%    move y0, x0
 1078:     %%
 1079:     %% a swap instruction would be emitted by beam_ssa_codegen:
 1080:     %%
 1081:     %%    swap x0, y0
 1082:     %%
 1083:     case [] of
 1084:         [] -> V
 1085:     end:all(),
 1086:     V.
 1087: 
 1088: grab_bag_16a(V) ->
 1089:     try
 1090:         catch 22,
 1091:     receive
 1092:     after bad ->
 1093:             not_reached
 1094:     end
 1095:     catch
 1096:         _:V ->
 1097:             error
 1098:     end.
 1099: 
 1100: grab_bag_16b(V) ->
 1101:     try
 1102:         receive
 1103:         after get() ->
 1104:                 ok
 1105:         end
 1106:     catch
 1107:         V:Reason ->
 1108:             Reason
 1109:     end.
 1110: 
 1111: grab_bag_17() ->
 1112:     try "xwCl" of
 1113:         V when V ->
 1114:             <<[] || V>>;
 1115:         [_|_] ->
 1116:             %% Constant propagation in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2
 1117:             %% would produce get_hd and get_tl instructions with literal
 1118:             %% operands.
 1119:             fact
 1120:     catch
 1121:         _:_ ->
 1122:             []
 1123:     end.
 1124: 
 1125: grab_bag_18() ->
 1126:     try 0 of
 1127:         _V0 ->
 1128:             bnot false
 1129:     after
 1130:         try [] of
 1131:             wrong ->
 1132:                 ok
 1133:         catch
 1134:             _:_ when false ->
 1135:                 error
 1136:         end
 1137:     end.
 1138: 
 1139: grab_bag_19() ->
 1140:     ([<<bad/utf8>>] =
 1141:          %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce single-valued phi
 1142:          %% nodes, which in turn would cause the constant propagation
 1143:          %% in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2 to produce get_hd and
 1144:          %% get_tl instructions with literal operands.
 1145:          try
 1146:              [whatever]
 1147:          catch
 1148:              _:_ when false ->
 1149:                  ok
 1150:          end) ! (some_atom ++ <<>>).
 1151: 
 1152: grab_bag_20() ->
 1153:     %% Similarly to grab_bag_19, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce
 1154:     %% single-valued phi nodes. The fix for grab_bag_19 would not
 1155:     %% suffice because several phi nodes were involved.
 1156:     {[_ | _] =
 1157:          receive
 1158:              list ->
 1159:                  "list";
 1160:              1 when day ->
 1161:                  []
 1162:          after
 1163:              0 ->
 1164:                  if
 1165:                      false ->
 1166:                          error
 1167:                  end
 1168:          end,
 1169:      try
 1170:          ok
 1171:      catch
 1172:          error:_ ->
 1173:              error
 1174:      end}.
 1175: 
 1176: %% With the `no_copt` and `no_ssa_opt` options, an internal
 1177: %% consistency error would be reported:
 1178: %%
 1179: %% Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
 1180: %% Instruction: {test_heap,2,2}
 1181: %% Error:       {{x,0},not_live}:
 1182: grab_bag_21(A) ->
 1183:     _ = id(0),
 1184:     grab_bag_21(ok, A div 10, node(), [-1]).
 1185: 
 1186: grab_bag_21(_, D, _, _) ->
 1187:     D.
 1188: 
 1189: %% GH-7128: With optimizations disabled, the code would fail to
 1190: %% load with the following message:
 1191: %%
 1192: %%    beam/beam_load.c(367): Error loading function
 1193: %%      beam_ssa_no_opt_SUITE:grab_bag_22/0: op get_list: Sdd:
 1194: %%         bad tag 2 for destination
 1195: grab_bag_22() ->
 1196:     maybe
 1197:         [_ | _] ?= ((true xor true) andalso foo),
 1198:         bar ?= id(42)
 1199:     end.
 1200: 
 1201: redundant_br(_Config) ->
 1202:     {false,{x,y,z}} = redundant_br_1(id({x,y,z})),
 1203:     {true,[[a,b,c]]} = redundant_br_1(id([[[a,b,c]]])),
 1204:     ok.
 1205: 
 1206: redundant_br_1(Specs0) ->
 1207:     {Join,Specs} =
 1208:         if
 1209:             is_list(hd(hd(Specs0))) -> {true,hd(Specs0)};
 1210:             true -> {false,Specs0}
 1211:         end,
 1212:     id({Join,Specs}).
 1213: 
 1214: -record(coverage, {name}).
 1215: 
 1216: coverage(_Config) ->
 1217: 
 1218:     %% Cover beam_ssa_codegen:force_reg/2
 1219:     no_match = case true of
 1220:                    <<_:42>> -> true;
 1221:                    _ -> no_match
 1222:               end,
 1223: 
 1224:     no_match = case [] of
 1225:                    <<$f:1.7>> -> ok;
 1226:                    _ -> no_match
 1227:                end,
 1228:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,$T},_}} = (catch coverage_1()),
 1229: 
 1230:     error = coverage_2(),
 1231:     ok = coverage_3(),
 1232:     #coverage{name=whatever} = coverage_4(),
 1233:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,ok},_}} = catch coverage_5(),
 1234: 
 1235:     ok.
 1236: 
 1237: coverage_1() ->
 1238:     <<area/signed-bitstring>> = $T.
 1239: 
 1240: coverage_2() when << []:<<0/native>> >> -> ok;
 1241: coverage_2() -> error.
 1242: 
 1243: coverage_3() ->
 1244:     %% Cover a line in beam_ssa_pre_codegen:need_frame_1/2.
 1245:     get(),
 1246:     ok.
 1247: 
 1248: coverage_4() ->
 1249:     try
 1250:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1251:         #coverage{}
 1252:     catch
 1253:         _:_ ->
 1254:             error
 1255:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1256: 
 1257: coverage_5() ->
 1258:     try
 1259:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1260:         ok
 1261:     catch
 1262:         _:_ ->
 1263:             error
 1264:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1265: 
 1266: %% Test beam_ssa:normalize/1, especially that argument types are
 1267: %% correctly updated when arguments are swapped.
 1268: normalize(_Config) ->
 1269:     normalize_commutative({bif,'band'}),
 1270:     normalize_commutative({bif,'+'}),
 1271: 
 1272:     normalize_noncommutative({bif,'div'}),
 1273: 
 1274:     ok.
 1275: 
 1276: -record(b_var, {name}).
 1277: -record(b_literal, {val}).
 1278: 
 1279: normalize_commutative(Op) ->
 1280:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1281:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1282:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1283: 
 1284:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1285:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1286: 
 1287:     normalize_swapped(Op, [Lit,A]),
 1288: 
 1289:     ok.
 1290: 
 1291: normalize_noncommutative(Op) ->
 1292:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1293:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1294:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1295: 
 1296:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1297:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1298: 
 1299:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1300:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, [Lit,A]),
 1301:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1302: 
 1303:     ok.
 1304: 
 1305: normalize_same(Op, Args) ->
 1306:     I0 = make_bset(#{}, Op, Args),
 1307:     I0 = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1308: 
 1309:     ArgTypes0 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1310:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1311:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1312: 
 1313:     case Args of
 1314:         [#b_var{},#b_var{}] ->
 1315:             ArgTypes1 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)},
 1316:                          {1,beam_types:make_integer(42)}],
 1317:             I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1318:             I2 = beam_ssa:normalize(I2);
 1319:         [_,_] ->
 1320:             ok
 1321:     end,
 1322: 
 1323:     ok.
 1324: 
 1325: normalize_swapped(Op, [#b_literal{}=Lit,#b_var{}=Var]=Args) ->
 1326:     EmptyAnno = #{},
 1327:     I0 = make_bset(EmptyAnno, Op, Args),
 1328:     {b_set,EmptyAnno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1329: 
 1330:     EmptyTypes = #{arg_types => #{}},
 1331:     I1 = make_bset(EmptyTypes, Op, Args),
 1332:     {b_set,EmptyTypes,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1333: 
 1334:     IntRange = beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023),
 1335:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,IntRange}],
 1336:     I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1337:     {[{0,IntRange}],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I2)),
 1338: 
 1339:     LitType = beam_types:make_type_from_value(Lit),
 1340: 
 1341:     ArgTypes1 = [{0,LitType}],
 1342:     I3 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1343:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I3)),
 1344: 
 1345:     ArgTypes2 = [{0,LitType},{1,IntRange}],
 1346:     I4 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1347:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I4)),
 1348: 
 1349:     ok.
 1350: 
 1351: make_bset(ArgTypes, Op, Args) when is_list(ArgTypes) ->
 1352:     Anno = #{arg_types => maps:from_list(ArgTypes)},
 1353:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args};
 1354: make_bset(Anno, Op, Args) when is_map(Anno) ->
 1355:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args}.
 1356: 
 1357: unpack_bset({b_set,Anno,{b_var,1000},Op,Args}) ->
 1358:     ArgTypes = maps:get(arg_types, Anno, #{}),
 1359:     {lists:sort(maps:to_list(ArgTypes)),Op,Args}.
 1360: 
 1361: trycatch(_Config) ->
 1362:     8 = trycatch_1(),
 1363: 
 1364:     ok = trycatch_2(id(ok)),
 1365:     ok = trycatch_2(id(z)),
 1366: 
 1367:     false = trycatch_3(id(42)),
 1368: 
 1369:     ok.
 1370: 
 1371: trycatch_1() ->
 1372:     try B = (A = bit_size(iolist_to_binary("a"))) rem 1 of
 1373:         _ ->
 1374:             A;
 1375:         _ ->
 1376:             B
 1377:     after
 1378:         ok
 1379:     end.
 1380: 
 1381: trycatch_2(A) ->
 1382:     try not (B = (ok >= A)) of
 1383:         B ->
 1384:             iolist_size(maybe
 1385:                             [] ?= B,
 1386:                             <<>> ?= list_to_binary(ok)
 1387:                         end);
 1388:         _ ->
 1389:             ok
 1390:     after
 1391:         ok
 1392:     end.
 1393: 
 1394: trycatch_3(A) ->
 1395:     try erlang:bump_reductions(A) of
 1396:         B ->
 1397:             try not (C = (B andalso is_number(ok))) of
 1398:                 C ->
 1399:                     ok andalso ok;
 1400:                 _ ->
 1401:                     C
 1402:             catch
 1403:                 _ ->
 1404:                     ok
 1405:             end
 1406:     after
 1407:         ok
 1408:     end.
 1409: 
 1410: %% The identity function.
 1411: id(I) -> I.
